fixes.name: Risk Date # of Days
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level Tableau expression [RISK_DATE]-[EFFECTIVE_DATE] to a DAX calculated column using direct subtraction between the two datetime columns. Comments were ignored.

fixes.name: Bear Flattener Normal Shock
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR Days = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Risk Date # of Days]
RETURN
IF(
    Days < 750, 5,
    IF(
        Days > 10950, 1,
        5 * (1 - (Days - 750) / (10950 - 750)) + (Days - 750) / (10950 - 750)
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau nested IF into DAX using VAR for readability. References to the dependent calculated field were converted to 'Table'[Field] format. The calculation is row-level (no aggregates), so it is created as a calculated column. Comments in the original Tableau formula were ignored.
